The block is nearly straight up and down.. so when I try to pull out a larger knife the handle hits the cabinet and I can't get it out with out tilting the block or moving the whole block forward. My old block didn't have as many knives, but it was tilted at a sharper angle so I could just pull the knives forward and out not up and out. content: I am beyond impressed with this knife set! From the moment I opened the box, I could tell this was a high-quality product. But more importantly â€” they perform exceptionally well.Each knife is razor-sharp right out of the box and slices through meats, veggies, and bread effortlessly. I especially love the chefâ€™s knife â€” itâ€™s perfectly balanced and feels great in the hand, making prep work a breeze. The handles are ergonomic and comfortable, even during longer cooking sessions.The set includes all the essentials, and the storage block keeps everything organized and within reach. I've noticed no dulling after weeks of daily use, and they're super easy to clean too.If you're looking for a dependable, stylish, and professional-quality knife set without breaking the bank, this is the one. author: Amazon Customer

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
content: I recently upgraded from a basic budget knife set, and the Chicago Cutlery Malden collection has been a huge step up. Right out of the box, the quality is obvious. The stainless steel knives look sleek and modern, and the wooden block adds a warm, professional touch that fits perfectly with my kitchen dÃ©cor. It looks clean and stylish without being too flashy.The knives are well-balanced and feel solid in the hand. I really like the contoured handlesâ€”theyâ€™re comfortable to grip and make prep work feel easier and smoother. So far, theyâ€™ve cut everything with ease, from slicing vegetables to trimming meats. I also love the built-in sharpener in the block. Itâ€™s such a smart, space-saving feature that helps keep the blades sharp without needing to buy a separate tool.That said, I ran into one big issue. I accidentally left one of the knives in the sink overnight, and by morning it had rusted significantly. Not only did the blade rust, but it also left a large rust stain in my sink. That was really disappointing, especially since I assumed stainless steel would be more resistant. I now make sure to dry each knife immediately after washing and never leave them wet or in the sink.Overall, this set has been a great upgrade in terms of both looks and performance. Just be cautious about keeping them dryâ€”these definitely require some care. Still, for the price and functionality, Iâ€™d recommend them if youâ€™re looking for a solid, attractive knife set.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
content: I stumbled across these knives while on vacation when the AirBnB we were staying at had a set in the kitchen.  I liked them so much that I looked them up and ordered a set for myself as soon as I came home.  That was in March 2019.They felt great in hand and actually made cooking more enjoyable because they performed so well.  We have used them almost daily for the past 7 years and have been BRUTAL on them.  Theyâ€™ve been dropped; left soaking in liquids for long periods of time; thrown around in the sink; smashed with heavy pans while in the sink; ran through the dishwasher a million times; etc. They have never been sharpened and are only slightly less sharp than when we first purchased them.  They are still very usable.The attached photos show the wear and tear as of today (1/8/26), nearly 7 years after purchase - both front and back. The purple chefâ€™s knife is the most used knife in the kitchen, hands down.  While there has been definite wearing of the coating within the last year or two, the handles still look like the day I bought them.  Everything is tight and there is zero rust (even after sitting in the dishwasher or water for long periods).  Tips are still in tact.  You canâ€™t possibly ask for better performance from a set of $30 knives.  These have outperformed more expensive knives Iâ€™ve owned by a mile!Iâ€™ve purchased multiple sets as gifts and Iâ€™m about to purchase a second set for a new home but my originals 100% still get the job done.  I couldnâ€™t be happier with the quality of these knives.

They responded quickly, asking that I provide photos of the product and my order number.No problem. Glad they want to make it right.After I replied, they went silent.I replied back a week later, "Hello? Still waiting for an update on this knife block situation?"Still no response.I email back a third time, telling them I'll just return the knives and leave a bad review.Still, nothing.I guess Astercook would rather take a bad review than make it right by sending a $10 plastic knife block.The knife quality is relatively fine. They're plastic-handled and light. I'll spend $20 more for metal knives that actually feel nice to use.Everybody saying, "Wow, they're so sharp!"--folks, all cheap knives are sharp when you first get them. Then they get dull, quickly.Would not recommend. Astercook, all you had to do was send me a new knife block. Pathetic.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
content: I am extremely impressed with this 16-Piece Kitchen Knife Set with Block. From the moment I opened the box, the quality and presentation stood out. The natural wenge wood block looks beautiful on the countertop and gives the kitchen a high-end, professional feel. Itâ€™s sturdy, well-finished, and holds each knife securely in place.The knives themselves are outstanding. Made from high carbon German steel, they are incredibly sharp right out of the box and slice through everything with ease, vegetables, meat, bread, and even delicate herbs. The balance and weight of each knife feel perfect in hand, making long prep sessions much more comfortable and precise. The ergonomic handles provide a secure, non-slip grip, which adds confidence and safety while cutting.I also really appreciate the variety in this 16-piece set. It covers every need in the kitchen, from chefâ€™s and slicing knives to utility and paring knives, plus the kitchen shears. The built-in sharpener is a fantastic bonus, allowing me to keep the blades in top condition without needing extra tools.Overall, this knife set delivers exceptional performance, durability, and style. It looks elegant, performs like professional-grade cutlery, and offers great value for the price. I highly recommend this set to anyone looking to upgrade their kitchen with a reliable, sharp, and beautiful knife collection.

content: I can only assume this German high-carbon steel began life as the remnants of a preâ€“World War II submarine prototype, later recovered through some clever global recycling program and reborn by master Chinese builders into this formidable tool.The full-tang handle, balance, and density are impeccableâ€”this cleaver feels less like a kitchen knife and more like a purpose-built instrument. Fit and finish are outstanding, especially at a price point that feels almost unbelievable for what youâ€™re getting.Serious performance, serious aesthetics, and zero gimmicks.
